Treatment includes rest, icing, NSAIDs and even oral corticosteroids (30 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days. Local cortisone injections are effective, but should be used as a second-line treatment, as spontaneous favourable evolution is the rule.

question.question: What is the recommended treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals?
question.option_a: Rest, icing, NSAIDs, and oral corticosteroids (30 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days
question.option_b: Local cortisone injections as the first line of treatment
question.option_c: Rest, icing, NSAIDs, and oral corticosteroids (30 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days, and local cortisone injections as a first-line treatment
question.option_d: Intravenous corticosteroids (60 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days
